feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
05/24 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-eleventh edition:

Markus
  • Logical Replication in PostgreSQL 10 - One of the big new features in the next version of PostgreSQL, whose first beta was just released.
  • How Technology Hijacks People’s Minds — from a Magician and Google’s Design Ethicist - Design matters, more in than just the obvious ways.
  • 10 things I learned making the fastest site in the world - Some interesting techniques to speed up web page loading and rendering.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
05/17 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-tenth edition:

Markus
  • Programming with a love of the implicit - DHH argues against “it’s always better to be explicit”
  • NASA’s ten coding commandments - Maybe following them everywhere would improve software quality in general? (although some of the rules are quite specific to low-level languages)
  • The Architects Below - Software influences behavior, often with implications that we software developers rarely think about when gathering requirements or building software.
Max
  • Untangling Ruby Threads - Great real world example (and explanation) of using threads in Ruby.
  • Insomnia - An interesting free and open source alternative to Postman.
  • Teaching RSpec to Play nice with Rails - The awesome Sam Phippen shares some insights on making RSpec compatible with Rails 5.1.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
05/10 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-ninth edition:

Markus
  • Postgres tips for Rails developers - A grab-bag of useful tips and tricks for using PostgreSQL with Rails.
  • Lies My Parents Told Me (About Logs) - Important facs about logs and logging.
  • How I converted my React app to VanillaJS (and whether or not it was a terrible idea) - This new VanillaJS framework looks really great and performant.
Max
  • thefuck - Extend “did you mean” to your terminal.
  • Factory Girl Instruments - Benchmark, trace and debug the base of your test suite: your factories.
  • Get started making music - Neat project by Ableton to teach the basics of making music in the browser.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
05/03 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-eighth edition:

Markus
  • Why Is Ruby Multithreading Slow? - Multithreading is hard, and it’s easy to do something wrong that impacts performance severely.
  • acli - Action Cable command-line client - For trying out, testing, and debugging.
  • mailcatcher - Catches mail and serves it through a dream - For easy testing and debugging sending mails.
Max
  • What Are Your Career Goals? - Interesting discussion over at dev.to.
  • Workflow - Awesome talk on dev workflows and though processes by searls.
  • GitHub::DS - Set of Ruby libs by Github to conveniently work with SQL on top of the ActiveRecord connection.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
04/26 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the two-hundred-seventh edition:

Markus
  • When debugging doesn’t suck: beautiful errors - Improving your error messages can be the difference between a difficult to debug problem, or a quick discovery of the underlying cause.
  • Syntactic Diabetes
  • The Inside Story Behind MS08-067 - How a nasty zero-day was discovered by Microsoft, and how the issue was handled internally.
